1.text: Paul, an apostle (not from men, neither through man, but through Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead),

2.text: and all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:

3.text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.text: who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us out of this present evil world, according to the will of our God and Father:

5.text: to whom be the glory for ever and ever. Amen.

6.text: I marvel that ye are so quickly removing from him that called you in the grace of Christ unto a different gospel;

7.text: which is not another gospel: only there are some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

8.text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, should preach unto you any gospel other than that which we preached unto you, let him be anathema.

9.text: As we have said before, so say I now again, If any man preacheth unto you any gospel other than that which ye received, let him be anathema.

10.text: For am I now persuading men, or God? or am I seeking to please men? if I were still pleasing men, I should not be a servant of Christ.

11.text: For I make known to you, brethren, as touching the gospel which was preached by me, that it is not after man.

12.text: For neither did I receive it from man, nor was I taught it, but it came to me through revelation of Jesus Christ.

13.text: For ye have heard of my manner of life in time past in the Jews’ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and made havock of it:

14.text: and I advanced in the Jews’ religion beyond many of mine own age among my countrymen, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.

15.text: But when it was the good pleasure of God, who separated me, even from my mother’s womb, and called me through his grace,

16.text: to reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the Gentiles; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:

17.text: neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me: but I went away into Arabia; and again I returned unto Damascus.

18.text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Cephas, and tarried with him fifteen days.

19.text: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord’s brother.

20.text: Now touching the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.

21.text: Then I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.

22.text: And I was still unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:

23.text: but they only heard say, He that once persecuted us now preacheth the faith of which he once made havock;

24.text: and they glorified God in me.
